author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 15-member unidentified gang hurled country-made bomb at two accused, who were on condition bail, outside the Integrated Court Complex here on Monday.

In the impact, a lawyer sustained injuries. The gang also hacked a person on the premises. Both were admitted to Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital.

Police said that Chelladurai and John of Kitchipalayam area were on conditional bail in the murder case of Napoleon, a history-sheeter, who was hacked to death in 2015.

As per their bail condition, the two had to sign at Judicial Magistrate Court II at 10 a.m. and 5 p.m. every day. On Monday, the gang that came in autorickshaws and on two-wheelers, waited for the two to come out of the court.

As both Chelladurai and John moved out on their two-wheelers at 5.30 p.m., the gang hurled the bomb on them. But, the bomb missed them and hit a wall.

Murugan, the lawyer, who was standing there, sustained minor injuries. The gang hacked Alaguvel, who had come there for a case, and chased Chelladurai and John on the court premises.

The police and lawyers pursued the gang members, but they fled the scene.

Napoleon’s brother and his gang allegedly attempted to murder the two.
title: Bomb hurled at accused outside court
